events: The system BIOS completes the Power-on Self-test (POST) and identifies the bootable storage device.
The bootloader loads the operating system kernel into memory and hands over execution control.
The kernel initializes system hardware drivers and mounts the root filesystem to access configuration files.
The service manager starts the networking stack and peripheral daemons required for user interaction.
The display manager launches the graphical login screen and awaits user authentication credentials.
question: In what sequence did the system prepare the environment before the user could log in?
hint: Identify the foundational hardware checks first, as the core must be established before high-level services can run because cause precedes effect.
